intro: Ormosia monosperma, commonly known as the single-seeded ormosia, is a member of the legume family Fabaceae. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces pods containing a single seed, which is a distinguishing feature. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it has a woody, aromatic bark. Ormosia monosperma is valued for its timber and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
